page.title: 17Living and working
page.content: Thirty nine people replied to our questionnaire on employment and lifestyles. 88% had lived in Catbrook less than l5 years and 33% less than five years. Only l2% had lived here more than l5 years. A third of those interviewed had moved from the south-east, and a quarter have moved from the local area. The remainder were North East 2% North West 2% Wales 3% West Country l4% and Midlands 2O%. Four workers are based at home, along with l2 housewives. The remaining 23 travel to work everyday. Of these ten travel over 3O miles each day and five over ten miles. This illustrates the development of this area as a commuter belt. Six individuals work for local authorities, five are self employed, five are managers and others range from a University professor to service engineers.
